za.ac.wits.elen4010.fluidsim.gui

Class SimulationInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • za.ac.wits.elen4010.fluidsim.gui.SimulationInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class SimulationInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Container class for the input of the simulation. Each input is represented as a Velocity which co- rresponds to each consecutive frame to be computed in the simulation. Note that a collection of f- rames should be computed such that they can be played back at 30Hz
    See Also:
    FileWriter, Velocity, Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.List<Velocity> frameByFrameInput
      List of vectors, represented in memory as a 'vector' data type
      private java.util.ListIterator<Velocity> nextVelocity
      Stores an iterator to the next velocity to be taken from the vector of velocities
      private java.awt.Dimension renderFrameDimensions
      Stores the dimension of the screen as defined at contruction and depending on the size of inp- ut screen in the GUI
      private static long serialVersionUID
      GUID for the serialised data

      • nextInputVelocity

        public Velocity nextInputVelocity()
        Returns the next Velocity stored in the list of Velocities NOTE: null is returned if the list of velocities is exhausted

        the list of Velocities assigned to the SimulationInput

      • getFrameCount

        public int getFrameCount()
        Returns the length of number of input samples (i.e. the number of frames to be rendered
        Returns:
        The number of frames to be rendered

      • getRenderingSize

        public java.awt.Dimension getRenderingSize()
        Returns the dimensions of the screen so that other components receiving a simulation input ca- n determine how large the rendering area shpuld be
        Returns:
        A Java 'Dimension' which has methods for getting the width and height of the screen
